poem:
Title: "In the Key of Two"

Life is the music of long friendships,
buying and selling of oddities.
Tom and Tim, 
stitched together in tune and time,
dance within the edges of madness.
Keane: the sound of battle's song,
Born of East Sussex soil,
nourished by the same rain,
rooted in shared memory-
A marriage of souls,
fused in harmony,
sustaining in rhythm.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Keane’s Tom Chaplin and Tim Rice-Oxley look back: ‘Long friendships are like a marriage. You have to adapt to each other’s madness’ Interactive Tom Chaplin (on left) and Tim Rice-Oxley in 1988 and 2024. Later photograph: Pål Hansen. Styling: Andie Redman. Grooming: Shukheel Murtaza at The Only Agency. Archive image: courtesy of Tim Rice-Oxley, Tom Chaplin Tom Chaplin and Tim Rice-Oxley are childhood friends and founding members of Keane, a group from Battle, East Sussex. The". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
